name: Juvenile Refuge (cover)
functionStatement: Physical and chemical conditions enable spawning, juvenile growth, migration, and stress survival of target taxa.
descriptionMarkdown: Sufficient cover (wood, undercuts, veg) for recruitment/survival if historically expected.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bed mostly sand or silt; no pockets or structural cover.
Criteria: Embeddedness >=75 percent; less than 5 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Gravels embedded with silt; few bank pockets or calm margins.
Criteria: Embeddedness 50-75 percent; about 5-20 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Light sand on riffles; scattered wood and bank cover.
Criteria: Embeddedness 25-50 percent; about 20-40 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Clean gravels with open spaces and many shallow pockets, wood, and vegetation.
Criteria: Embeddedness 0-25 percent; over 40 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.
